intro: Terebinthus mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican terebinth, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and produces fragrant, resinous sap. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. The sap of Terebinthus mexicana has been used traditionally for its medicinal and aromatic properties.
